entry.title: Leveling up your Jupyter notebook skills
entry.summary:
Description

Most of us regularly work with Jupyter notebooks, but fail to see obvious productivity gains involving its usage. Did you know that the web interface works like a modal editor such as VIM? Do you know that you can actually profile AND debug code in notebooks? How about setting formulas or use pre-made style settings for visualizations? Let us go through the tricks of the trade together!

Abstract

Overview of the Jupyter project + setup to get everyone on board. Handling the UI, know the shortcuts Different type of cells Exporting notebooks for presentations Handling different kernels Set styles for visualizations for professional quality Mod the style of the web interface yourself via CSS Profiling code in notebooks, use Cython Debugging in notebooks
